definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: Durge would take great satisfaction in being able to kill legions of his sworn enemies.
sentences.chinese: 德奇将从杀死整团整团的死敌中获得极大的满足。

sentences.english: The traitors were spat on and cursed by the people.
sentences.chinese: 这一卖国贼营垒是中国人民的死敌。

sentences.english: But the external perception of a city being left behind by its nearest rival remains.
sentences.chinese: 但是外界对它落后于近邻死敌的观念依然存在。

sentences.english: Leimer will not continue to fly long - haul away the sworn enemy of Stuttgart.
sentences.chinese: 而不莱梅则要继续长途飞行客场挑战死敌斯图加特。

sentences.english: Adams and I were deadly enemies.
sentences.chinese: 亚当斯和我是不共戴天的死敌。

sentences.english: It comes down to this, Nineveh, the city to be absolved was the murderer of his family.
sentences.chinese: 这座他要布赦免的尼尼微城是毁灭他家族的死敌。

sentences.english: This camp of traitors are deadly enemies of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 这一卖国贼营垒是中国人民的死敌。

definition: (of enemies) cannot live under the same sky/absolutely irreconcilable
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
correct/normal/to be on good terms with/on the right track/right
to fight to one's last gasp
